definition: Suzhou 蘇州|苏州[Su1 zhou1] and Hangzhou 杭州[Hang2 zhou1]
Perilla frutescens (Chinese basil or wild red basil)/place name/to revive/used as phonetic in transliteration
surname Su/abbr. for Soviet Union 蘇維埃|苏维埃 or 蘇聯|苏联/abbr. for Jiangsu province 江蘇|江苏/abbr. for Suzhou city 蘇州|苏州
surname Hang/Hangzhou
lit. there is heaven above, and there is 蘇杭|苏杭[Su1 Hang2] below (idiom)/fig. the beauty and affluence of Suzhou and Hangzhou is comparable with heaven
pinyin: shang4 you3 tian1 tang2 , xia4 you3 Su1 Hang2

sentences.english: Just as there is paradise in heaven, ther are Suzhou and Hangzhou on earth.
As a popular Chinese saying goes, "There is paradise in heaven, while there are Suzhou and Hangzhou on earth."
sentences.chinese: 中國有一句話是這麼說的，“上有天堂，下有蘇杭。”

sentences.english: As a popular Chinese saying goes, "there is a paradise in heaven, while there are Suzhou and Hangzhou on earth."
sentences.chinese: 中國有一句話是這麼說的，“上有天堂，下有蘇杭。”

sentences.english: There is the chinese old saying "Paradise in Heaven, Suzhou and Hangzhou on earth."
sentences.chinese: 中國古語有云“上有天堂，下有蘇杭”。

sentences.english: Jervois beauty of the world must, Guilin, a human landscape.
sentences.chinese: 蘇杭美景天下絕，桂林山水甲人間。
